description.overall: The function 'position_count' takes a pandas DataFrame as input and groups the data by the column 'KvaRechnung_ID'. For each unique 'KvaRechnung_ID', it counts the number of associated 'Position_ID' entries. The result is a new DataFrame containing two columns: 'KvaRechnung_ID' and 'PositionsAnzahl', which represents the count of positions for each ID. This operation is useful for aggregating transactional or inventory data by a key identifier.

parameters.name: input_df
parameters.description: DataFrame that is to be evaluated.

returns.name: position_count
returns.description: DataFrame with the columns 'KvaRechnung_ID' and the amount of associated positions.

description.overall: This function evaluates a DataFrame containing 'Auftragsdaten' data to identify instances where, if at least two values among the three columns Forderung_Netto, Empfehlung_Netto, and Einigung_Netto are negative, the third value should also be negative. It counts and returns the number of violations of this rule. The function uses boolean masking to determine which rows meet the criteria and sums up the violations across all three columns.

parameters.name: df
parameters.description: DataFrame with 'Auftragsdaten' data set that is to be evaluated.

returns.name: error_count
returns.description: Number of entries in any of the three columns Forderung, Empfehlung or Einigung failing the check.

description.overall: The function evaluates a 'Positionsdaten' dataset contained in a pandas DataFrame for entries in specific columns that fall outside of a reasonable value range. It specifically checks for negative values in columns such as 'Menge', 'Menge_Einigung', 'EP', 'Ep_Einigung', 'Forderung_Netto', and 'Einigung_Netto'. The function aggregates the count of invalid entries across these columns and returns the total error count. This is useful for identifying potential data quality issues in financial or inventory datasets.

parameters.name: df2
parameters.description: DataFrame containing 'Positionsdaten' data set that is to be evaluated.

returns.name: total_errors
returns.description: Total amount of non-valid entries aggregated over all relevant columns.

description.overall: The function 'above_50k' filters a pandas DataFrame to identify rows where the 'Einigung_Netto' column has values greater than or equal to 50000. It is designed to flag potentially suspicious financial entries that may require manual review due to their high value. The function takes a DataFrame as input and returns a filtered DataFrame containing only the rows that meet the specified condition.

description.overall: This function identifies outliers in a specified numeric column of a pandas DataFrame based on a given quantile range, considering different damage types. It calculates symmetric upper and lower bounds for each group of damage types and filters the DataFrame to return only rows that fall outside these bounds. The function allows filtering by a specific damage type and supports custom column selection for outlier detection.

parameters.name: df
parameters.description: DataFrame to be evaluated

parameters.name: schadenart
parameters.description: specific damage type label to filter for, by default None

parameters.name: set_quantile
parameters.description: desired quantile range, symmetric upper/lower bound is inferred, by default 0.99

parameters.name: column_choice
parameters.description: numeric column containing outliers, by default 'Forderung_Netto'

returns.name: df_outlier
returns.description: df containing all suspicious rows

description.overall: The function 'check_zeitwert' evaluates whether the values in the column 'Differenz_vor_Zeitwert_Netto' satisfy a specific condition related to 'Zeitwert = Forderung-Einigung'. It computes the relative error by comparing the difference between 'Forderung_Netto' and 'Einigung_Netto' with the 'Differenz_vor_Zeitwert_Netto'. This function is intended for use with 'Auftragsdaten' datasets. The result is a pandas Series containing only the non-zero error values.

parameters.name: df
parameters.description: DataFrame containing 'Auftragsdaten' data set that is to be evaluated.

returns.name: zeitwert_error
returns.description: Series of all error values (float) found in the data frame

description.overall: This function calculates the average number of positions per order for each month based on two input DataFrames: one containing order data and another with position data. It aggregates the position counts per order, merges them with time-based order information, and computes monthly averages, totals, and counts. The result includes a growth rate percentage to show changes over time.

parameters.name: df
parameters.description: Auftragsdaten mit Spalte 'KvaRechnung_ID' und einer Zeitspalte.

parameters.name: df2
parameters.description: Positionsdaten mit Spalten 'KvaRechnung_ID' und 'Position_ID'.

parameters.name: time_col
parameters.description: Name der Zeitspalte in orders_df (z.B. 'CRMEingangszeit').

returns.name: result
returns.description: DataFrame mit Spalten: 'Zeitperiode', 'Avg_Positionen_pro_Auftrag', 'Total_Positionen', 'Anzahl_Auftraege', 'Growth_rate_%'

description.overall: Die Funktion aggregiert die Fehlerhäufigkeit (NaN-Werte) in einem DataFrame nach Wochentag und Stunde. Ein Auftrag gilt als fehlerhaft, wenn in mindestens einer der relevanten Spalten ein NaN-Wert vorhanden ist. Sie wandelt die Zeitspalte in ein Datetime-Format um, extrahiert Wochentag und Stunde, bestimmt relevante Spalten zur Prüfung auf NaN-Werte und berechnet anschließend die Fehlerquote pro Zeitblock. Das Ergebnis ist ein DataFrame mit den Spalten 'weekday', 'hour', 'total_rows', 'error_rows' und 'error_rate'.

parameters.name: df
parameters.description: Auftragsdaten-DataFrame (z.B. Auftragsdaten_konvertiert), muss 'KvaRechnung_ID' und die Zeitspalte enthalten.

parameters.name: time_col
parameters.description: Name der Zeitspalte in df, z.B. 'CRMEingangszeit'.

parameters.name: relevant_columns
parameters.description: Liste der Spalten, die auf NaN geprüft werden sollen. Wenn None -> alle Spalten außer 'KvaRechnung_ID' und time_col.

returns.name: result
returns.description: DataFrame mit Spalten: 'weekday' (Name des Wochentags), 'hour' (Stunde von 0 bis 23), 'total_rows' (Anzahl Aufträge in diesem Zeit-Slot), 'error_rows' (Anzahl fehlerhafter Aufträge in diesem Slot), 'error_rate' (Fehlerquote in Prozent).

usage_context.calls: This function calls no other functions.
usage_context.called_by: This function is not called by any other functions.

description.overall: The function 'get_mismatched_entries' computes similarity scores between pairs of 'Gewerk_Name' and 'Handwerker_Name' entries in a DataFrame using sentence embeddings. It leverages a pre-trained multilingual model to encode the text and calculates cosine distances to determine similarity. Entries with similarity scores below a given threshold are identified as mismatches and returned sorted by similarity score.

parameters.name: df
parameters.description: The input DataFrame containing columns 'Gewerk_Name' and 'Handwerker_Name' to compare.

parameters.name: threshold
parameters.description: A similarity threshold below which entries are considered mismatches. Default is 0.2.

returns.name: mismatches
returns.description: A copy of the input DataFrame filtered to include only rows where the similarity score is less than the specified threshold, sorted in ascending order of similarity score.

usage_context.calls: This function calls no other functions.
usage_context.called_by: This function is not called by any other functions.

description.overall: This function processes a DataFrame to identify outliers in the relationship between craftsmen and their specialties (Gewerke). It calculates the ratio of each specialty per craftsman and flags those specialties as outliers if they represent less than 20% of the craftsman's total specialties and the craftsman has more than one specialty. The function filters out missing values and returns a DataFrame with the results.

parameters.name: df
parameters.description: A pandas DataFrame containing columns 'Handwerker_Name' and 'Gewerk_Name'.

returns.name: stats
returns.description: A pandas DataFrame containing the processed data with columns 'Handwerker_Name', 'Gewerk_Name', 'count', 'total_count', 'ratio', 'anzahl_gewerke', and 'is_outlier'.

usage_context.calls: This function calls no other functions.
usage_context.called_by: This function is not called by any other functions.

description.overall: This function analyzes a DataFrame to determine if the 'Handwerker_Name' column contains keywords associated with specific trades ('Gewerk_Name'). It uses a predefined mapping of keywords for each trade to identify potential matches. If a keyword is found in the name and corresponds to the expected trade, it marks the entry as 'CONFIRMED_BY_NAME'. If a keyword is present but does not match the trade, it flags a conflict with the corresponding trade. Otherwise, it returns 'NO_KEYWORD_INFO'.

parameters.name: df
parameters.description: A pandas DataFrame containing at least two columns: 'Handwerker_Name' and 'Gewerk_Name'.

returns.name: final_result
returns.description: An array or Series of strings indicating the result for each row: 'CONFIRMED_BY_NAME', 'CONFLICT_WITH_<TRADE>', or 'NO_KEYWORD_INFO'.

usage_context.calls: This function calls no other functions.

description.overall: Die Funktion 'abgleich_auftraege' vergleicht die Kopfdaten von Aufträgen (df1) mit der Summe ihrer Positionen (df2). Sie gruppiert die Positionsdaten nach 'Kva_RechnungID', bildet die Summen für 'Forderung_Netto' und 'Einigung_Netto', und führt einen Vergleich mit den Werten in df1 durch. Dabei werden Gleitkommazahlen berücksichtigt. Die Funktion gibt einen DataFrame mit den IDs und Differenzen zurück, bei denen die Werte nicht übereinstimmen.

parameters.name: df1
parameters.description: Dataframe mit den Auftragsdaten (Soll-Werte). Muss folgende Spalten enthalten: 'Kva_RechnungID', 'Forderung_Netto', 'Einigung_Netto'.

parameters.name: df2
parameters.description: Dataframe mit den Positionsdaten (Ist-Werte). Muss folgende Spalten enthalten: 'Kva_RechnungID', 'Forderung_Netto', 'Einigung_Netto'.

returns.name: result_df
returns.description: Ein DataFrame mit den IDs und Differenzen, bei denen die Werte nicht übereinstimmen. Enthält die Spalten 'KvaRechnung_ID', 'Diff_Forderung', 'Diff_Einigung'.

usage_context.calls: This function calls no other functions.
usage_context.called_by: This function is not called by any other functions.
